benchmark_details.name: ROBOSPATIAL
benchmark_details.overview: ROBOSPATIAL is a large-scale dataset for spatial understanding in robotics, consisting of real indoor and tabletop scenes, captured as 3D scans and egocentric images, annotated with rich spatial information relevant to robotics.
benchmark_details.data_type: 2D images and 3D scans with spatial relationship annotations

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate spatial understanding in vision-language models (VLMs) for robotics applications.

data.source: Annotated indoor scene and tabletop RGBD datasets.
data.annotation: Automatically generated from 3D geometry and 2D image annotations using a customizable data generation pipeline.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions compared to ground truth spatial relationships.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better spatial reasoning capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Models trained on ROBOSPATIAL consistently outperform baseline methods on evaluation benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Validated through comprehensive experimentation on held-out and out-of-domain benchmarks.
